alert.note: Alert for Sierra; Yuba (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 3:27PM PDT until June 10 at 3:45PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Plumas, Sierra and Yuba along highway 49 west of Downieville. * WHEN...Until 930 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downieville, La Porte, American House and Little Grass Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
